abstract: "Gráfika: 30 Artists of Young Spain," an exhibition of urban art by artists born in the 1970s and '80s, runs from Oct. 7 to Jan. 15 at the Instituto Cervantes in Madrid.
snippet: "Gráfika: 30 Artists of Young Spain," an exhibition of urban art by artists born in the 1970s and '80s, runs from Oct. 7 to Jan. 15 at the Instituto Cervantes in Madrid.
lead_paragraph: Drive along Spain's highways long enough and you might pass the silhouette of a black bull that stands nearly 46 feet high. Originally an advertising campaign for the Osborne sherry company, the bull -- there are actually a number of them across Spain -- has since become a national symbol. In 2006, after almost 50 years since the first "Osborne bull" went up, the Madrid-based artist SpY, who has often been referred to as the Spanish Banksy, protested bullfighting by splattering one of the bulls with a huge splash of red paint.

headline.main: Young Artists the Focus at Madrid Show
